intro: Corispermum marginatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf corisperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopdiaceae. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in saline or arid environments. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are often green with a reddish tinge. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and it produces small, dry fruits called utricles. This species is adapted to harsh conditions and is often found in coastal or inland saline soils.
